title.narrative: COVID-19 emergency response Colombia for indigenous people in seven departments

description.narrative: In the context of the COVID19 pandemic, which has affected Indigenous people disproportionately, this project seeks to provide food and hygiene kits for members of Indigenous communities in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta (Cesar Department) and Amazon region (Amazonas, Vaupés and Guanía Department), as well people affected by ongoing armed conflict the Norte de Santander department (border to Venezuela). CINEP, as part of the Colombian Jesuits have historic presence in these areas working with local communities and organizations. They will reach 144 vulnerable families of Arhuaco, Wiwa, Kankuamo, Wanano, Desano Uitoto, Bora, Muinane, Okaina, Sikuani and Curripaco Peoples in remote areas, as well as providing protective bio security kits for 40 unarmed Indigenous guards, and enabling 25 Indigenous leaders to carry out culturally appropriate action for the protection from the pandemic.
